header.title: Queen Latifah dishes on sexism in the music industry, R Kelly, and feminism
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: In a wide-ranging interview with the Yahoo News show Through Her Eyes, rapper, singer, actor and producer Queen Latifah discusses racism in America and changes that still need to be made in the music industry.

Hi, well look at Queen, still popping (that's considered a good thing), and yes I would agree that women continue to have problems. She mentioned inequality in pay and asked the question, "What is the problem?". The answer to that would be society. Unfortunately, we live in a world that is  highly male-favoring and not very "female-friendly", that's been a reality for quite some time. In other words, people, whether they realize it or not, tend to have a negative attitude towards women and a more favorable attitude towards men. What women and girls need more than anything is self-acceptance, if we can get to the point to where we accept our female selves and don't feel the need to measure up to the fellas then perhaps things will start to become better for us. There's a need for a better attitude towards women or just accepting women as they are and what they're known for doing or liking to do, that's where it starts. I would also say that there's a need for our own culture (and lingo) because believe it or not that happens to be something women are lacking in, as we would since we've basically been "invisible" in a world that favors men. Because he wasn't trying to change. R Kelly got his second chance in life after his trial and went right back to preying on teenage girls. At some point we have to cut off people who don't want to do better.

You can have redemption...but you've got to have self awareness, admit wrongs and change. And I'm SO tired of people saying don't judge....uuuugghh, we all do it. Should most be less judgmental? Yeah, prob so. However, humans are wired to judge situations...like 'is it safe to have my children go to that person's house?' 'Should I hang out with so and so?' 'What do I believe' etc, etc.. Suspending all judgement, makes us unaware, unsure and empty...never standing for anything. If we really never had judgment we could be very vulnerable to being used, manipulated etc. You've got to use your brain to figure out what you want to do, who is safe to be around...all judgements. I try to be fair to other humans, however I'm going to use my common sense and intuition to judge situations and people I will, or won't be safe around, or want to emulate. I'm proud of those who will speak up to societal wrongs. It has to happen.
